snippet: The bank will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of a foreclosure settlement with authorities.
abstract: Bank of America will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of a foreclosure settlement with state and federal authorities; cuts for homeowners who owe more than their homes are worth could total more than $100,000 each; bank hopes it can reduce what it owes in penalties under the settlement by up to $850 million.
lead_paragraph: The bank will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of a foreclosure settlement with authorities.
